results.title: Rio Bravo
results.creator_credit: Howard Hawks, Armada Productions and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Sheriff John T. Chance arrests a gunslinger for a brutal murder. However, the outlaw’s brother is the most powerful rancher on the border and his desperadoes surround Rio Bravo so that Chance can’t get his prisoner out and the U.S. Marshall can’t get in. Hired gunmen slip silently into the little town, waiting for a chance to strike. This classic western combines the talents of John Wayne and Dean Martin with the much acclaimed skill of Howard Hawks.

results.creator_credit: Karl McPhee, Peter Thompson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A dramatized film which takes a light-hearted look at one hundred years of the telephone in Australia.

results.title: Ring [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Hideo Nakata, Takenori Sento, Takashige Ichise, Shinya Kawai, Ace Pictures and Omega Project
results.brief_description: A chilling and atmospheric film delving into the devastating effects of human curiosity. Journalist Reiko Ashakawa (Nanako Matsushima) is investigating the credibility of claims that a “video curse” is linked to the gruesome deaths of groups of teenagers. An urban myth circulating among teenagers recounts tales of people dying exactly a week after viewing a videotape featuring a bizarre sequence of images. Reiko is drawn deeper into this mystery after her cousin Tomoko dies under sinister circumstances. When she learns that both Tomoko and Tomoko’s friend, who watched the eerie video together, died at exactly the same time, she begins to take the matter more seriously. Tracking down a copy of the tape, she suddenly finds that she has become the next victim of the “video curse”. Joining forces with her psychic ex-husband, Ryugi Takayama (Hiroyuki Sanada), Reiko is caught in a frantic race against time to save both herself and her son Yoichi (Rikiya Itaka), from the unseen evil that reaches out to them from beyond the grave. Based on a series of best-selling novels by Koji Suzuki, “Ring” signifies a shift toward a more sophisticated type of horror film which openly acknowledges the influence of Hollywood horror while taking it in an entirely different and unexpected direction.

results.title: Ring 2 = Ringu 2
results.creator_credit: Hideo Nakata, Makoto Ishihara, Takashige Ichise and Kadokawa Shoten Publishing Company
results.brief_description: Following in the wake of the phenomenally successful horror film “Ring”, this sequel (also directed by Hideo Nakata) picks up where the original ended. Mourning the death of her boyfriend and intrigued by the mystery of the evil spirit, Sadako, a journalist searches for Reiko and her son, who are missing. Whilst not containing the chilling scares of “Ring”, this thriller manages to entertainingly and engagingly continue Sadako’s story and the mysterious powers of the videotape that sentences those who watch it, to death. Cast includes: Miki Nakatani, Hitomi Sato, Kyoko Fukada, Nanako Matsushima and Hiroyuki Sanada.

results.title: Rikky and Pete = Rikky & Pete
results.creator_credit: Nadia Tass, David Parker and Cascade Films
results.brief_description: Rikky is a talented and would be singer and her brother, Pete, is a mechanical genius. After Pete pulls one practical joke too many, they escape Melbourne for an adventure in the outback eventually finding themselves amongst the characters of a mining town. Stars Stephen Kearney and Nina Landis with Bill Hunter, Bruno Lawrence and Bruce Spence in supporting roles.

results.title: ASL interpreter at Rihanna's Super Bowl performance shines
results.material_description: Digital screen recording of @EyezQueenRF's Tiktok post
results.brief_description: Justina Miles is the first female deaf performer at the Super Bowl’s halftime show. Her joyful ASL (American Sign Language) interpretation of Rihanna’s performance drew much love online. In a press conference the 20 year old said, “I value the opportunity to make it possible for all deaf people to enjoy these songs, and not have them miss out on the full Super Bowl experience.”
results.title_for_label: ASL interpreter at Rihanna’s Super Bowl performance shines
results.description: Justina Miles is the first woman deaf performer at the Super Bowl’s halftime show. Her joyful ASL (American Sign Language) interpretation of Rihanna’s performance drew love from all over the internet. In a press conference the 20 year old said, “I value the opportunity to make it possible for all deaf people to enjoy these songs, and not have them miss out on the full Super Bowl experience.”
description_for_label: Justina Miles is the first woman deaf performer at the Super Bowl’s halftime show. results.title: Rights from the heart. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Therese Descary and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: These seven short animated films from the National Film Board of Canada are united by their inspiration from the 1990 United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child. Each film addresses a specific right that was agreed upon by the convention. They are designed to encourage children to think about the world in which they live. The films contain no dialogue. Part 2 is intended for children aged 9-12. The films are Jonas and Lisa” (dirs: Zabelle Cote, Daniel Schorr); “The Tournament (dir: Francine Desbiens); “Overdose” (dir: Claude Cloutier); “An artist” (Dir: Michele Cournoyer); “Baroque’n roll” (dir: Pierre M. Trudeau); “Ex-child” (dir: Jacques Drouin); “Why?” (dir: Bretislav Pojar). A resource guide for educators is included.

results.title: Ring 0: Birthday = Ringu 0: Basudei
results.creator_credit: Norio Tsuruta, Masao Nagai, Takashige Ichise, Ring 0 Production Group and Asmik Ace Entertainment
results.brief_description: Ring O: Birthday, a prequel to the phenomenally successful “Ring” and “Ring 2” films by Hideo Nakata, provides the back-story of Sadako - the murdering, vengeful spirit that haunts the living via video-tape. Set in the 1960s, Sadako is a shy student, who earns the wrath of her colleagues when she attracts the attention of the drama club director. Suspicions about Sadako rise when mysterious deaths start to occur. With less thrills and shocks of the originals, “Ring 0” still impresses with its tension and dramatic staging of Sadako’s tragic past. Cast includes Yukie Nakama, Seiichi Tanabe and Yoshiko Tanaka.

results.title: Rights from the heart. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Therese Descary and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: These seven short animated films from the National Film Board of Canada are united by their inspiration from the 1990 United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child. Each film addresses a specific right that was agreed upon by the convention. They are designed to encourage children to think about the world in which they live. They are also inspired by a range of posters from Pierre Post. The films contain no dialogue. “123 Coco” (dir. Pierre M. Trudeau): A young girl struggles in Maths but finally works it out thanks to visualisation. “Papa” (dir. Michele Pauze): The impressions of a young child as they wait for their busy father to play. “T.V. Tango” (dir. Martine Chartrand): A visual illustration of the influence of television on impressionable young minds. “The Orange = L’Orange” (dir: Diane Chartrand): A hungry boy reminisces about a wonderful orange he once had and a thoughtful teacher gives a valuable lesson in acceptance. “Door to door = Porte a porte” (dir: Zabelle Cote): When a class of young children are bullied by the older kids they pool their efforts to get some respect. “A Family for Maria = Une famille pour Maria” (dir. Lina Gagnon): A beggar girl finds herself adopted by a loving family but struggles to forget her past. “To see the world = Voir le monde” (dir: Francine Desbiens): Sleeping on a train a young boy is exposed to the hardships faced by children across the world.

results.title: Rififi a Tokyo = Rififi in Tokyo
results.brief_description:
Following the success of Jules Dassin’s ‘Rififi’, producers decided to exploit the franchise. A number of caper dramas involving a complex robbery were produced in a variety of locations, including Japan. In this particular installment a gang of thieves is planning on taking hold of a single diamond stored in the vaults of a Japanese bank.

Credits: Producer, Jacques Bar ; director, Jacques Deray ; writers, Auguste Le Breton, Jose Giovanni, R. M. Arlaud ; photography, Tadashi Arakami ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Keiko Kishi, Barbara Lass, Karl-Heinz Boehm, Charles Vanel, Hideaki Suzuki, Michel Vitold.
